availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles S. Rouse (Adair County, Kentucky, student and soldier in the 37th KY)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Solomon Rouse and Nancy S. Rouse. Resident in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Student in Adair County in 1860. Served in Company E 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from October 24, 1863, to March 28, 1864. Died of camp fever in Glasgow, Kentucky, on March 28, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 67A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 81.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 419.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 376.
"Pvt Charles S Rouse (1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #3200257, accessed January 7, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3200257.
